title: AUTOMIC Wins 2015 Ventana Research Technology CFO Award for Finance Automation
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/15/2015 @ 8:25 AM   Automic 
SEATTLE -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- AUTOMIC, the leader in Business Automation, today announced it has won a 2015 Ventana Research Technology Innovation Award for its finance automation solution that supports the Office of the CFO. AUTOMIC was selected for its innovation and ability to help a wide array of organizations reach new goals and generate more value from these finance functions. 
“Recognition in the Ventana Research Technology Innovation Awards further validates the value of automation in business. Companies like GE, eBay, LinkedIn, Genworth , NHS and many more are using AUTOMIC to empower their businesses through automation" said Todd DeLaughter, CEO, AUTOMIC. "Our Oracle EBS and SAP customers are using AUTOMIC to enable their teams to work more productively and generate greater value for their businesses by being able to free-up time to focus on strategy and innovative new ideas". 
AUTOMIC enables finance teams to automate financial close faster, at lower cost and with less stress than the traditional processes employed across most teams. Through business automation, a process that can take days if not weeks, can be shortened to a few hours empowering CFO's to free-up resources to focus on driving the strategic future of their company. Business automation enables self-service for business users across all departments from finance to service desks to Big Data analysts. 
The National Health Service in the UK, NHS SBS, recently implemented AUTOMIC’s Financial Automation solution to automate and therefore significantly accelerate the month end financial close process for over 300 NHS Trusts and commissioning organizations. Since implementation, their use of automation has resulted in an 80% reduction in penalties for missing critical client KPIs. The use of AUTOMIC was initiated to support the 12x business growth of NHS SBS over the last few years. 
“Advancing financial processes requires them to be efficient which happens through automation and then enabling time to optimize and improve,” said Mark Smith, Ventana CEO and Chief Research Officer. “We congratulate AUTOMIC for its advancement in automation and its platform that when applied to finance can help CFO drive excellence in its processes and the entire business.”

About Ventana Research and the Technology Innovation Awards 
Ventana Research is the most authoritative and respected benchmark business technology research and advisory services firm. Ventana Research provides the most comprehensive analyst and research coverage in the industry; business and IT professionals worldwide are members of our community and benefit from Ventana Research's insights, as do highly regarded media and association partners around the globe. The Technology Innovation Awards distinguish pioneers that have developed clear visionary and transformative technology. The Technology Innovation Awards showcase what technology vendors have done to advance the computing potential of their applications and technology so that it can be used to drive better efficiency and productivity as well as the outcomes and performance of an organization. The Ventana Research Technology Innovation Awards cover 28 business and technology categories and are open for organizations across business and IT, technology vendors and consulting firms. Submissions are evaluated based on the stringent guideline set out by awards program criteria. 
To learn more about the winners and why they are innovative, register for the Ventana Research webinar which will be held on October Friday, October 16, 2015 from 1:30 PM EDT / 10:30 AM PDT here . 
About AUTOMIC 
AUTOMIC, a leader in business automation, helps enterprises drive competitive advantage by automating their IT and business systems - from on-premise to the Cloud, Big Data and the Internet of Things. With offices worldwide, AUTOMIC powers over 2,600 customers including Bosch, Netflix, eBay, AMC Theatres, Carphone Warehouse, ExxonMobil, BT Global Services, Société Générale, NHS SBS, General Electric and Swisscom. The company is privately held by EQT. More information can be found at www.automic.com .
